arm_group.description: experimental conventional laryngoscopy group: laryngoscope is used to assist for nasotracheal intubation.
experimental video-stylet group:video-stylet is used to guide nasotracheal tube into trachea

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study  is to compare conventional laryngoscopy with video-stylet
      (Trachway) for nasotracheal intubation in patients undergoing oro-maxillo-facial surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. patients with American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I-III

          2. aged 20-65 years

          3. Requiring Nasotracheal Intubation under general anesthesia

          4. unlimited mouth open

          5. unlimited neck motion

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. mouth open ＜ 3 cm

          2. Ankylosing arthritis patients.

          3. BMI≧35 kg/m2

intervention.description: the device is to assist nasotracheal intubation
the device is to guide the nasotracheal tube into trachea

facility.name: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Conventional Laryngoscopy and Video-stylet to Assist Nasotracheal Intubation for Patients Undergoing Oro-Maxillo-facial Surgery

other_outcome.description: Events of intubating related nasal bleeding are recorded on selected nostril and oral cavity at 3 minutes post-intubation and post-operatively. Incidences of sore throat and hoarseness are evaluated before patients out of recovery room and the following morning
other_outcome.measure: postoperative nasal bleeding, sore throat and hoarseness

overall_official.affiliation: Department of anesthesiology, Kaohsiung Medical University, Taiwan

primary_outcome.description: Nasotracheal intubation assisted by a video-stylet may be performed in patients undergoing oro-maxillo-facial surgery following induction of anesthesia (fentanyl 2 micro-gram/kg, thiamylal 5 mg/kg, cis-atracurium 0.2 mg/kg and propofol 1 mg/kg)
primary_outcome.measure: number of the patients with successful nasotracheal intubation and scoring difficult intubation scale

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: time of Intubating the nasotracheal tube (NT) from selected nostril to trachea is continuously calculated but separately into two parts. part one: from termination of mask ventilation and mask removed from face, to the NT tip on the nasopharynx. part two: advancing NT from nasopharynx, through vocal cord into trachea, to present of 3 end tidal carbon dioxide waveforms.

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
